intro: Trigonidium tenue, commonly known as the slender trigonidium, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Trigonidium tenue is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
